title: Fadi Abboud
text:
Fadi or Fady Elias Abi Abboud (<a href="Arabic">Arabic</a>: فادي عبود; born 21 March 1955) is a <a href="Lebanon">Lebanese</a> politician and businessman.
Early life and education.
Abboud was born into a <a href="Maronite%20Christianity%20in%20Lebanon">Maronite Christian</a> family in Sakiyat Al Misk on 21 March 1955. He graduated from the International School of Choueifat and later studied economics at the <a href="University%20of%20Westminster">University of Westminster</a> in <a href="London">London</a>.
Career.
Abboud began his career as the chairman of General Packaging Industries in 1982. He was twice appointed the president of the Association of Lebanese Industrialists. He was also a member of the American Lebanese Chamber of Commerce and the <a href="International%20Chamber%20of%20Commerce">International Chamber of Commerce</a>.
He was appointed minister of tourism in the <a href="Saad%20Hariri">Saad Hariri</a>'s <a href="Lebanese%20government%20of%20November%202009">cabinet</a> in November 2009. He was reappointed to the same post in the <a href="Najib%20Mikati">Najib Mikati</a>'s <a href="Lebanese%20government%20of%20June%202011">cabinet</a> in June 2011. Abboud's term ended on 15 February 2014 and Michel Pharoun was appointed tourism minister.
Alliances.
Abboud is close to <a href="Syrian%20Socialist%20Nationalist%20Party">the Syrian Socialist Nationalist Party</a> and <a href="Free%20Patriotic%20Movement">the Free Patriotic Movement</a>.
Personal life.
Abboud married Sara Lilianna Saban in 1986. They have two children.
